BriefDescription: VSU instruction was issued to VSU pipe 0
PM_ULTRAVISOR_INST_CMPL
Processor cycles
External interrupt due to Event Based Branch. This means the PMU interrupt is being handled by user code.
Cycles when the speculative counter for PMC3 is frozen
marked store completed in L2 ( RC machine done)
Loads that finished without experiencing an L1 miss
Marked ld latency
Cycles in which the NTC instruction is held at dispatch because of power management
Cycles in which the oldest instruction in the pipeline was waiting for a load miss to resolve from a neighbor chiplet's L2 or L3 in the same chip.
Cycles in which the NTC sync instruction is a lwsync waiting to be allowed to complete
Cycles in which Superslice 0 dispatches either 1 or 2 instructions

Cycles spent in the nest portion of a marked Stcx instruction. It starts counting when the operation starts to drain to the L2 and it stops counting when the instruction retires from the Instruction Completion Table (ICT) in the Instruction Sequencing Unit (ISU)
PM_ADJUNCT_CYC
sampled Instruction suffered an icache Miss
Marked demand reload
Floating Point Operations Completed
Cycles in which at least one thread has the run latch set
All L1 D cache load references counted at finish, gated by reject. In P9 and earlier this event counted only cacheable loads but in P10 both cacheable and non-cacheable loads are included
Cycles in which the NTC instruction is held at dispatch due to Issue queue full. Includes issue queue and branch queue
Cycles in which all the threads have the run latch set
PM_ADJUNCT_INST_CMPL
Stcx instructions finished. This includes instructions in the speculative path of a branch that may be flushed
External interrupt initiated by the Hypervisor
An instruction was marked at decode time. Random Instruction Sampling (RIS) only
The marked instruction was a decimal floating point op issued to the VSU. Measured at issue time
The marked instruction was a fixed point op issued to the VSU. Measured at issue time
Cycles when the speculative counter for PMC4 is frozen
PM_ICBI_FIN
VSU instruction was issued to one of the VSU pipes. Up to 4 per cycle.  Includes fixed point ops.
Cycles in which Superslice 1 dispatches either 1 or 2 instructions
Cycles in which Superslice 1 dispatches either 3 or 4 instructions
PM_DISP_HELD_HALT_CYC
Cycles in which this thread's run latch is set and the core is in SMT4 mode
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a memory location including L4 (if applicable) from local remote or distant due to a marked load
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a location other than the local core's L3 due to a marked load
Threshold counter exceeded a value of 512
# PPC Dispatched
TIQ reject for stores
VSU marked instr finish.  Excludes simple FX instructions issued to LSU
marked store finished with intervention
Cycles in which the oldest instruction in the pipeline was waiting for a load miss to resolve from local memory, L4 or OpenCapp chip
Hierarchical TLB found parent entry but child entry was not found in the TLB.  2-level TLB, second level miss
Cycles when the speculative counter for PMC1 is frozen
LSU Finished an internal operation in ST2 port
PM_SYS_PUMP_MPRED_TOO_BIG
Ptesync latency from the cycle the instruction becomes NTC until it completes in the nest
Cycles in which the oldest instruction in the pipeline was waiting for a load miss to resolve from either the local L2 or local L3, without an RC dispatch conflict
PM_PRIVILEGED_INST_CMPL
Memory Read With Intent to Modify for this thread.
mult marked instr
External interrupt initiated by the OS
L3 castouts in Mepf state for this core.  This event was reported by thread in P9 but reported for the whole core in P10.
cycles to drain st from core to L2
Cycles in which Superslice 0 dispatches either 3 or 4 instructions
Cycles in which Superslice 0 dispatches either 5, 6, 7 or 8 instructions
PM_DISP_HELD_ISSQ_FULL_CYC
The marked instruction was dependent on a load.  It is eligible for issue kill
timebase event
A trigger generated from the debug logic for lab use
Marked Start probe nop dispatched.  Instruction AND R0,R0,R0
PM_SMT_MODE_SWITCH
PM_VSU_FIN
Cycles in which the oldest instruction in the pipeline was waiting for a load miss to resolve from a distant chip (cache, L4, memory or CAPP chip)
Internal doorbell interrupt
PMC3 Rewind Value saved
PM_HYPERVISOR_INST_CMPL
PM_PROBLEM_INST_CMPL
Cycles in which the thread is in Ultravisor state.  MSR[S HV PR]=110
Cycles in which the thread is in Privileged state.  MSR[S HV PR]=x00
Instructions finished
PM_L2_PWC_HIT
PM_L3_PWC_HIT
Cycles spent in the core portion of a marked Stcx instruction.  It starts counting when the instruction is decoded and stops counting when it drains into the L2
Cycles when the speculative counter for PMC1 is frozen
MMA single precision instruction completed
MMA double precision instruction completed
MMA half precision instruction completed
Counts once for either multiply only or multiply-add.  Counts instructions, not FLOPS
Counts once for either multiply only or multiply-add.  Counts instructions, not FLOPS
Counts once for either multiply only or multiply-add.  Counts instructions, not FLOPS
Counts once for either multiply only or multiply-add.  Counts instructions, not FLOPS
Move to VSR.  mfacc and setaccz.  Implies priming
Move from VSR.  Mfacc
Counts all MMA instructions that are multiply only.  This implies priming
Marked store had to do a bkill
Vector load instructions completed
lwsync instruction completed
hwsync instruction completed
A floating point instruction of any type completed.  It counts once for each 1, 2, 4 or 8 flop instruction.  Use PM_1|2|4|8_FLOP_CMPL events to count flops
two flops completed (fmadd, fnmadd, fmsub, fnmsub) Scalar instructions only.
Scalar flop completed
Math flop instruction completed
Any Branch instruction completed
Branch whose target address is lower than the program counter
Conditional branch completed
Instruction that contains a prefix completed
The marked instruction was flushed
Cycles in which Superslice 0 dispatches either 5, 6, 7 or 8 instructions
Marked instruction was reloaded from a location beyond the local chiplet
The processor's data cache was reloaded from a location other than the local core's L2 due to a marked load
Run_Instructions
